intro: Acosta boissieri subsp. mariolensis, commonly known as the Mariolense acosta, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
